name: Adrenalin

indications.text: adrenalin ® non-selective alpha beta adrenergic agonist indicated : emergency treatment allergic ( type 1 ) , including anaphylaxis ( 1.1 ) increase mean arterial blood pressure adult patients hypotension associated septic shock ( 1.2 )

contraindications.text: anaphylaxis : adults children 30 kg ( 66 lbs ) : 0.3 mg 0.5 mg ( 0.3 ml 0.5 ml ) intramuscularly subcutaneously anterolateral aspect thigh every 5 10 minutes necessary ( 2.2 ) children 30 kg ( 66 lbs ) less : 0.01 mg/kg ( 0.01 ml/kg ) , 0.3 mg ( 0.3 ml ) , intramuscularly subcutaneously anterolateral aspect thigh every 5 10 minutes necessary ( 2.2 ) hypotension associated septic shock : dilute epinephrine dextrose solution prior infusion ( 2.3 ) infuse epinephrine large vein ( 2.3 ) intravenous infusion rate 0.05 mcg/kg/min 2 mcg/kg/min , titrated achieve desired mean arterial pressure ( 2.3 ) wean gradually ( 2.3 ) full prescribing information instructions dilution injection .

warningsAndPrecautions: adrenalin 1 mg/ml single dose vials : carton contains 25 single dose vials containing 1 mg/ml adrenalin ( epinephrine injection , usp ) solution 3 ml clear glass vial . ndc : 70518-1342-00 ndc : 70518-1342-01 packaging : 25 1 carton packaging : 1 ml 1 vial . type 0 vial contents must discarded 30 days initial . store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . epinephrine light sensitive . protect light freezing . inspect visually particulate matter discoloration prior . solution colored cloudy , contains particulate matter . repackaged distributed : remedy repack , inc. 625 kolter dr. suite # 4 indiana , pa 1-724-465-8762
indications_original: Adrenalin ® is a non-selective alpha and beta adrenergic agonist indicated for: Emergency treatment of allergic reactions (Type 1), including anaphylaxis ( 1.1 ) To increase mean arterial blood pressure in adult patients with hypotension associated with septic shock ( 1.2 )
contraindications_original: Anaphylaxis : Adults and Children 30 kg (66 lbs) or more : 0.3 mg to 0.5 mg (0.3 mL to 0.5 mL) intramuscularly or subcutaneously into anterolateral aspect of the thigh every 5 to 10 minutes as necessary ( 2.2 ) Children 30 kg (66 lbs) or less : 0.01 mg/kg (0.01 mL/kg), up to 0.3 mg (0.3 mL), intramuscularly or subcutaneously into anterolateral aspect of the thigh every 5 to 10 minutes as necessary ( 2.2 ) Hypotension associated with septic shock: Dilute epinephrine in dextrose solution prior to infusion ( 2.3 ) Infuse epinephrine into a large vein ( 2.3 ) Intravenous infusion rate of 0.05 mcg/kg/min to 2 mcg/kg/min, titrated to achieve desired mean arterial pressure ( 2.3 ) Wean gradually ( 2.3 ) See Full Prescribing Information for instructions on dilution and administration of the injection.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Adrenalin 1 mg/mL Single Dose Vials:
                  Each carton contains 25 single dose vials containing 1 mg/mL Adrenalin (epinephrine injection, USP) solution in a 3 mL clear glass vial.
                  NDC: 70518-1342-00
                  NDC: 70518-1342-01
                  PACKAGING: 25 in 1 CARTON
                  PACKAGING: 1 mL in 1 VIAL. TYPE 0
                  
                  Vial and contents must be discarded 30 days after initial use.
                  Store between 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F) [See USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Epinephrine is light sensitive.  Protect from light and freezing.
                  Inspect visually for particulate matter and discoloration prior to administration.  Do not use the solution if it is colored or cloudy, or if it contains particulate matter.
                  
                  Repackaged and Distributed By:
                  Remedy Repack, Inc.
                  625 Kolter Dr. Suite #4 Indiana, PA 1-724-465-8762
